result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory D Mahlum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-On May 31, 2018 Court orders restitution in the amount of $11,210.00 which has been PAID IN FULL.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory D Mahlum

records.addlTxt: Terminated Regular - 12/11/2018
(Written)
Defendant's Response to State's Brief Regarding Restitution
State's Brief Regarding Restitution
Victim's Cost of Plows
State's Exhibit #1 - Bank Document
State's Exhibit #1

12:00 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - discussion before going on the record.  Statement by DA Christenson.  Statement by Atty Roeth - agrees that a check bounced, and believes that under the law that interest is not allowed under restitution.

Darrell Schueler sworn, direct by DA Christenson is the owner of Darrell's Auto Repair in the Town of Princeton.  Testimony given.  DA offers State's Exhibit #1 - Bank Document.  No objection by Atty Roeth.  Court receives State's Exhibit #1.  Cross exam by Atty Roeth.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  Re-cross by Atty Roeth.

Court requests the witness to get to the DA's office the amount that he pays for the items.  Court orders counsel to prepare a one page Brief and file with the court - DA has 30 days and Atty Roeth has 2 weeks after that.

Court adjourned at 12:22 p.m.
Restitution hearing on February 6, 2018 at 11:30 am.

11:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to an amended count of misdemeanor issuance of worthless check with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended count 1.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Serntencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders any restitution on file be paid to the victim.

Restitution - To be determined at a Restitution Hearing on February 6, 2018 at 11:30 a.m.  NO objection by Atty Roeth.

Court adjourned at 12:05 p.m.
